definition[0]: to start a meeting, discussion, performance etc by saying or doing something
example[0]: I’d like to lead off by thanking Rick for coming.
example[1]: The French team led off with two quick goals in the first five minutes.
example[2]: Hal led the evening off with some folk songs.
definition[1]: if a road, room etc leads off a place, you can go directly from that place along that road, into that room etc
example[3]: a large room, with doors leading off it in all directions
example[4]: He pointed down a street leading off from the square.
definition[2]: to be the first player to try to hit the ball in an inning (=period of play) in a game of baseball
definition[3]: happening or going first or before others
